text: Madison County is a county located in the northeastern part of the U.S. state of Georgia. As of the 2020 census, the population was 30,120. The county seat is Danielsville. The county was created on December 5, 1811. The county's largest city is Comer with a population of 1,200. ==References== Category:1810s establishments in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:1811 establishments in the United States Category:Georgia (U.S. state) counties
title: Madison County, Georgia
